events.originalText: The Azure Window, a limestone natural arch in Gozo, Malta, collapsed during a storm.
events.subtitle: Azure Window
events.headline: Azure Window in Gozo, Malta Collapses During Storm

events.originalText: Cold War: In a speech to the National Association of Evangelicals in Orlando, Florida, U.S. president Ronald Reagan described the Soviet Union as an "evil empire".
events.subtitle: Cold War
events.headline: Ronald Reagan Calls Soviet Union 'Evil Empire' in Orlando Speech

events.originalText: Images taken by Voyager I proved the existence of volcanoes on Io, a moon of Jupiter.
events.subtitle: Voyager 1
events.headline: Voyager I Images Confirm Volcanoes on Jupiter's Moon Io

events.originalText: BBC Radio 4 began broadcasting Douglas Adams's The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy, a science fiction radio series that was later adapted into novels, a television series, and other formats.
events.subtitle: BBC Radio 4
events.headline: BBC Radio 4 Airs The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

events.originalText: Nelson's Pillar, a large granite pillar topped by a statue of Lord Nelson in Dublin, Ireland, was severely damaged by a bomb.
events.subtitle: Nelson's Pillar
events.headline: Nelson's Pillar in Dublin Damaged by Bomb

events.originalText: The Ba'ath Party came to power in a coup d'état by a clique of quasi-leftist Syrian Army officers calling themselves the National Council for the Revolutionary Command.
events.subtitle: Ba'ath Party
events.headline: Ba'ath Party Seizes Power in Syrian Coup

events.originalText: Three violent explosions at a coal mine near Castle Gate, Utah, killed all 171 miners working there.
events.subtitle: Castle Gate Mine disaster
events.headline: Explosions at Utah Coal Mine Kill 171 Miners

events.originalText: During the Egyptian Revolution, British authorities arrested rebel leader Saad Zaghloul and exiled him to Malta.
events.subtitle: 1919 Egyptian Revolution
events.headline: British Authorities Arrest Rebel Leader Saad Zaghloul

events.originalText: French aviator Raymonde de Laroche became the first woman to receive a pilot's licence.
events.subtitle: Raymonde de Laroche
events.headline: Raymonde de Laroche First Woman to Get Pilot's Licence

events.originalText: Nader Shah, the founder of the Afsharid dynasty, was crowned Shah of Iran.
events.subtitle: Nader Shah
events.headline: Nader Shah Crowned Shah of Iran

events.originalText: Anne (pictured) became the Queen of England, Scotland and Ireland, succeeding her brother-in-law William III.
events.subtitle: Anne, Queen of Great Britain
events.headline: Anne Becomes Queen of England, Scotland, and Ireland

events.originalText: After a devastating defeat in the Second Northern War, King Frederick III of Denmark–Norway was forced to give up nearly half his Danish territory to Sweden to save the remainder.
events.subtitle: Second Northern War
events.headline: King Frederick III of Denmark–Norway Loses Territory to Sweden

events.originalText: The court of Northampton County, Virginia, issued a ruling that made John Casor the first person of African descent in the Thirteen Colonies to be declared a slave for life as a result of a civil suit.
events.subtitle: Northampton County, Virginia
events.headline: John Casor Declared First African Slave for Life in Thirteen Colonies

events.originalText: A Spanish colonial officer wrote a letter to King Philip II containing the first mention of the Maya ruins of Copán in present-day Honduras.
events.subtitle: Philip II of Spain
events.headline: Spanish Officer Mentions Maya Ruins of Copán in Letter to King Philip II
